issue_description: # [BUG]: Arrows to change between testimonials are not correctly oriented in Arabic language. ### Describe the bug The right and left arrows on Oppia home page is not oriented when we change the language to Arabic, also there is no hover effect to give a good UI experience. ### Steps To Reproduce 1. Go to Oppia home page (don't sign in). 2. Change the language to Arabic. 3. Scroll down to the testimonials section. ### Expected Behavior The arrows should be oriented properly as in English language. ### Screenshots/Videos Screenshot: Video: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96219910/220284710-282152c8-198b-46b7-b620-507b581d42f1.mp4 ### What device are you using? Desktop ### Operating System Windows ### What browsers are you seeing the problem on? _No response_ ### Browser version _No response_ ### Additional context _No response_

issue_comments.body:
@Guptarohit2003 Per the guidance at https://github.com/oppia/oppia/wiki/Contributing-code-to-Oppia#choosing-a-good-first-issue, please provide an explanation of what your PR will do (with **names of files** you're changing, what you plan to change in each file, etc.). If it looks good, we can assign you to this issue. Thanks!

Also, make sure to do the change locally (not just in the browser), and show screenshots of both the English and Arabic versions to make sure that your change is not messing up the left-to-right versions. Thanks!
Hi @Patel-Muhammad, thanks for proposing this as a good first issue. I am removing the label for now and looping in @DubeySandeep to approve the label. It will be added back if approved. Thanks!

Hi!
I tried to reproduce this error in 2 browsers (1. Chrome and 2. Brave) and I could not reproduce this error.
![2023-02-22 20-00-35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/93364240/220653321-02e46e43-6229-42b2-b807-1a330cc3ba6d.gif)

@darechan, It is not supposed to look like `> <` in urdu.
It should be`< >` , like we have in other languages.

If you want to work on this please read @seanlip's comment above..
Thanks.

@seanlip @Ash-2k3 @Patel-Muhammad 
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/124484591/220884126-8cfd3b90-00bd-43b2-afbe-445b6d66b349.mp4
I think if we remove "display : inline-block" property and add some CSS properties like margin then this will resolve our issue.
could you please tell me is this ok?

@cipherbhai, As mentioned in @seanlip's above comment  please do the changes locally(in your local machine)  and show screenshots of both the English and Arabic versions to make sure that your change is not messing up the left-to-right versions.
Thanks

I'd like to contribute to this issue and will start investigating the cause of the problem.

Let me know if you're also working on this. Excited to contribute!

Hi @seanlip @Ash-2k3 I found the solution of the issue the file in which the changes are to be made is linked below. https://github.com/oppia/oppia/blob/dcdf7f3cc131f8243240dbae3c6db6717e387f23/core/templates/pages/splash-page/splash-page.component.html And the changes are I just interchanged right and Left The proof is ![issue6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/118007662/221115758-2b110cbb-daca-4772-b109-e29482bf7f54.png) I think I have solved the issue. Please ASSIGN this issue to me.
@AdityaRaimec22 Can you also show a screenshot of what it looks like when you select a non-RTL language in the navbar?

I have fully fixed the issue.

PR : https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/17466

> I have fully fixed the issue.
> 
> PR : #17466
It will be closed for sure bro Because you were not assigned to it. And I have found the solution so the issue will be assigned to me and I will create a PR so my friend find another issue.

@AdityaRaimec22 Actually, I think @AbhiXShakya's solution is closer to what is needed. I've left a comment in his PR.

I would advise not presuming whose solution is better without getting the necessary feedback first.

> @AdityaRaimec22 Actually, I think @AbhiXShakya's solution is closer to what is needed. I've left a comment in his PR.
> 
> I would advise not presuming whose solution is better without getting the necessary feedback first.

I have also added Non-RTL Video in the PR https://github.com/oppia/oppia/pull/17466
Thanks @AbhiXShakya -- it looks great. I've assigned you!

> Thanks @AbhiXShakya -- it looks great. I've assigned you!

Awesome!!

@AbhiXShakya's PR did not fix the issue. I am deassigning him from this issue and it is open to anyone to fix.

@AdityaRaimec22 if you still want to take up this issue, let's continue from [this comment](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/17427#issuecomment-1442909430).

> @AbhiXShakya's PR did not fix the issue. I am deassigning him from this issue and it is open to anyone to fix.
> 
> @AdityaRaimec22 if you still want to take up this issue, let's continue from [this comment](https://github.com/oppia/oppia/issues/17427#issuecomment-1442909430).

I found the issue, it was due to CSS was replaced by the code every ltr was replaced by rtl in CSS. So I placed the dir in tag.

Here's the video with local server shown also with RTL.


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71962115/222191778-b4385e84-18a9-4685-b2a6-bb0cf42cf05b.mov

I need to ask 1 thing, Should I Create a new PR ? because old PR was merged or I need to commit these changes to my old PR.
Thanks @AbhiXShakya, this is better. You can create a new PR. I'm reverting the old one.
